result.execSummary:
The defendant Malinda Ann Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Malinda Ann Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Malinda Ann Johnson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Malinda Ann Johnson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malinda Ann Johnson

records.addlTxt:
10:56 AM Defendant Malinda Ann Johnson in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Malinda Ann Johnson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates resolution reached. Defendant will plead to counts 2 and 4, remaining counts dismissed. 180 days each count concurrent but consecutive to 21CM345 if revoked, I&S for 2 years, 2 days jail, 2 credit, $50 fine plus costs, DOC programming.  In 21CM345 stipulation to modify terms of agreement to follow all recommendations of AODA and provide a copy within 30 to 60 days.
Court accepts modification of deferred agreement in 21CM345.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. All remaining counts in 22CF146 dismissed. 
Court orders 180 days each count, concurrent, consecutive to 21CM345 if revoked, I&S 2 years probation, 2 days jail, 2 credit, time served, DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs, bail applied, 120 days to pay or payment plan
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments whose primary purpose is to serve alcohol.
No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments whose primary purpose is to serve alcohol.
Stipulation of parties to amend bond conditions
Stipulation and order to amend bail conditions

9:58 AM Defendant Malinda Ann Johnson in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Malinda Ann Johnson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant makes oral request to be able to return home, cites reasons.
Court denies request at this time.

No contact with victim 1 or address as listed on ID Key. May make trip to residence with LE to retrieve personal property. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting any establishment who's primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Let COC know address within 24 hours of release from custody.
(also $450cb)

No contact with victim 1 or address as listed on ID Key. May make trip to residence with LE to retrieve personal property. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting any establishment who's primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Let COC know address within 24 hours of release from custody.
(also $2000sb)

1:57 PM Defendant Malinda Ann Johnson appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Craker special appearance.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Attorney Peter Kruger.
Court requests alternate address for defendant. Defendant indicates no alternate address, has no one here.Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State requests-750cb No contact with victim 1 or address as listed on ID Key. No use or possession of alcohol. Do not go to any establishment who's primary business is the sale of alcohol.
on deferred for prior case, same victim, bond conditions, commission of new crimes
Attorney does not believe cash nec, minimal criminal history, superior resident, no plans to leave the area. Request one time return trip with law enforcement to residence.
Court reviews argument and concerns; deferred and failing to comply. Questions if small amount/any amount able to post.
Court orders 450cb and 2000sb No contact with victim 1 or address as listed on ID Key. May make trip to residence with LE to retrieve personal property. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting any establishment who's primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. Let COC know address within 24 hours of release from custody.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signature bond and conditions; 2021CM000345; Johnson, Malinda Ann
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
